intro: Comolia lanceiflora, commonly known as the lanceleaf comolia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Comolia lanceiflora is often found in wetland habitats and is an important component of the local flora in its native range.
